subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] new font released
msgSnippet: ... I haven t bothered to look up the specific characters you re using, but I d guess you re using a word processor (such as MS Word) which has a long list of
messageBody:
pgabhart skribis:
>
> There are a couple of weird things happening
> though, and I'm not sure what is causing it. When
> I type "I-t" and then space, the letter is changing
> to "E-at." Also, when I typed the word "don't"
> and then space, the vowel changes to "O-n." and
> an apostrophe appears between the n and t. Does
> this make any sense?

I haven't bothered to look up the specific characters
you're using, but I'd guess you're using a word
processor (such as MS Word) which has a long list
of common misspellings that it silently changes while
you type. For example, if you type "teh", it changes
to "the" automatically. I've turned all these off on my
system since I often use non-Latin fonts.

--Ph. D.
